data.title: Ideas 2 Innovation: Entrepreneurship @ Amherst
data.snippet: College for their funding & support! Special thanks to our keynote speaker Kevin Ma '23 (Previous President Amherst College Quant Club , current Trader Jane Street ) for sharing invaluable insights during the competition kick-off. üèÜ Estimathon¬Æ: ü•á (1st): Mersad Abbasi , Claudiu Babin , Andreas Rasvanis , Jakia Tajnur Chowdhury ü•à(2nd): Seth Yoo , Michael Zheng , Alex Van Lidth, Miranda Yang , Sherlyn Saavedra üåü (Honorable Mention): Deshan de Mel , Skyler Lee, Megan Li , Allison Klingler üèÜ Brainteaser Battle: ü•á (1st): Alex Van Lidth ü•à(2nd): Mersad Abbasi üåü (Honorable Mention): Megan Li üèÜ Coding Challenge: ü•á (1st): Claudiu Babin ü•à(2nd): Andreas Rasvanis üèÜ Algo Trading: ü•á (1st): Megan Li , Skyler Lee, Deshan de Mel ü•à(2nd): Yichen L. , Surya Rao üåü (Honorable Mention): Isaiah Gonsalves üèÜ Manual [...] Ideas 2 Innovation: Entrepreneurship @ Amherst (1w): We went from completing one project per semester to three in three weeks. The secret? SCRUM. Read more in our reflection on how SCRUM transformed the i2i engineering team. #SCRUM #AgileManagement #EngineeringLeadership #SoftwareEngineering #ProjectManagement #RustLang #OpenSource #StudentEntrepreneurs [Likes: 15, Comments: 0]; Kamil Mouehla (8mo): I‚Äôm excited to share that I won second place at Ideas 2 Innovation: Amherst College's Venture Accelerator 2 Innovation: Amherst College‚Äôs Venture Accelerator Startup Lab! During the event, I pitched TrackBin, a real-time GPS tracking solution for municipal waste management, designed to improve efficiency and accountability in trash collection. A huge thank you to Alexander Nichols and Nikol [...] full-stack services with news-based fluctuations powered by ElevenLabs , and our custom bots simulating real-world scenarios, securing essential funding, and helping out with the logistics. üìà Tairan "Ryan" Ji , for designing an engaging Algorithmic Trading Case with real-world data and Gradescope API integrations, which showcased participants' coding and quantitative skills. Participants' strategies were put head on with the benchmarks created in "one-shot" inference using Perplexity Deep Research, OpenAI o3-mini-high, Microsoft Phi4, and Google Gemini. Thanks to Prof. Ivan Contreras & Prof. Rasheed for helping us in designing Brainteaser Battle! And a massive thank you to our sponsors, Jane Street , Summit Securities Group , Amherst College for their funding & support! Special thanks to

data.title: Miro Babin's Post - LinkedIn
data.snippet:
# Miro Babin‚Äôs Post

Miro Babin

 Report this post

Proud to celebrate an outstanding performance of the Amherst College team‚ÄîAndreas Rasvanis, Sherry Jiang, and Claudiu Babin‚Äîat the 2024 ICPC Northeast Regional this past Sunday! Competing on-site against 105 teams from universities across New England and five Canadian provinces, our team took 1st place among undergraduate institutions and 16th place overall, solving 8 out of 13 problems. A huge thank you to the organizers and sponsors for making this event possible, as well as to the Amherst CS department for their invaluable support. Special shoutout to Jane Street for the Robert Frost inspired t-shirt!

data.title: [PDF] cholera in haiti - CDC
data.snippet: Statistical analyses were performed to identify differences among patients by cause of death. Because the number of patients who died of myocarditis and viral sepsis was small, these cases were excluded from statistical analyses. We also excluded 1 patient who died of presumed incidental intracranial hemorrhage. The Kruskal-Wallis test was used to compare numerical variables. When a p value 1994 Emerging Infectious Diseases ‚Ä¢ www.cdc.gov/eid ‚Ä¢ Vol. 17, No. 11, November 2011 Pandemic (H1N1) 2009 among Children, Japan <0.05 was obtained by Kruskal-Wallis test, post hoc testing was performed by using the Tukey test. We compared categorical variables by using the œá2 test. When the œá2 test gave a p value <0.05, adjustment residual analysis was performed. An absolute value of the adjustment [...] Two research groups collaborated to collect detailed data on deaths associated with pandemic (H1N1) 2009 among children. The collaborative study group comprised 3 chief members (A.O., S.N., and H.K.) and 6 assistant members (T.M., O.S., J.F., C.T., S.K., and T.I.). During February‚ÄìJune 2010, members of the collaborative study group contacted the attending physician of each child who died and visited the hospital to obtain detailed information. We abstracted data from medical records by using a structured report form and obtained demographic, clinical, laboratory, and radiologic data from interviews with attending physicians and chart reviews. Onset of inÔ¨Ç uenza was considered the time at which a temperature >38¬∞C was Ô¨Å rst recorded.
